info.title: ClickUp API v2 Reference
info.description:
The ClickUp API enables you to programmatically access and manage your ClickUp resources.

## Authentication
The API supports two authentication methods:
- **Personal API Token**: Use for testing and personal integrations. Add token to requests with header: `Authorization: pk_...`
- **OAuth 2.0**: Required for building apps for other users. Uses authorization code flow.

## Getting Started
Our [Getting Started Guide](https://developer.clickup.com/docs/index) provides a comprehensive overview of how to use the ClickUp API.

get.description:

 \
If you do not include the `start` and `start_id` parameters, this endpoint will return the most recent 25 comments.\
 \
Use the `start` and `start id` parameters of the oldest comment to retrieve the next 25 comments.

 \
For example: `custom_task_ids=true&team_id=123`.

get.description: View the Custom Fields you have access to in a specific List.

View the Custom Fields you have access to in a specific Folder. Get Folder Custom Fields only returns Custom Fields created at the Folder level. Custom Fields created at the List level are not included.

View the Custom Fields you have access to in a specific Space. Get Space Custom Fields only returns Custom Fields created at the Space level. Custom Fields created at the Folder and List level are not included.

View the Custom Fields you have access to in a specific Workspace. Get Workspace Custom Fields only returns Custom Fields created at the Workspace level. Custom Fields created at the Space, Folder, and List level are not included.

parameters.name: team_id

post.description:
Add data to a Custom field on a task. \
 \
You'll need to know the `task_id` of the task you want to update, and the universal unique identifier (UUID) `field_id` of the Custom Field you want to set. \
 \
You can use [Get Accessible Custom Fields](ref:getaccessiblecustomfields) or the [Get Task](ref:gettask) endpoint to find the `field_id`.

parameters.name: task_id
parameters.description: Enter the task ID of the task you want to update.

parameters.name: field_id
parameters.description: Enter the universal unique identifier (UUID) of the Custom Field you want to set.

parameters.name: custom_task_ids
parameters.description: If you want to reference a task by its Custom Task ID, this value must be `true`.

parameters.name: team_id
parameters.description:
When the `custom_task_ids` parameter is set to `true`, the Workspace ID must be provided using the `team_id` parameter.

 \
For example: `custom_task_ids=true&team_id=123`.

anyOf.title: URL Custom Field
anyOf.description: The `value` must be a string with a valid URL.

anyOf.title: Dropdown Custom Field
anyOf.description: Enter the universal unique identifier (UUID) of the dropdown menu option you want to set. You can find the UUIDs available for each Dropdown Custom Field using [Get Accessible Custom Fields.](ref:getaccessiblecustomfields) New Dropdown Custom Field options cannot be created from this request.

anyOf.title: Email Custom Field
anyOf.description: The `value` must be a string with a valid email address.

anyOf.title: Phone Custom Field
anyOf.description: The `value` must be a string with a valid country code.

anyOf.title: Date Custom Field
anyOf.description: The `value` must be Unix time in milliseconds. To display the time in a Date Custom Field in ClickUp, you must include `time: true` in the `value_options` property.

anyOf.title: Short or Long Text Custom Field

value.example: This is short or long text in a Custom Field.

anyOf.title: Money Custom Field
anyOf.description: You can set an amount, but not the currency of a Money Custom Field via the API. You can check the currency of a Money Custom Field using [Get Accessible Custom Fields.](ref:getaccessiblecustomfields)

anyOf.title: Task Relationship Custom Field
anyOf.description: Enter an array of task ids in the `add` property to add them to a Task Relationship Custom Field. Enter them into the `rem` property to remove tasks from the Relationship.

anyOf.title: People Custom Field
anyOf.description: Enter an array of user ids or a Team id in the `add` property to add them to a People Custom Field. Enter them into the `rem` property to remove users from a People Custom Field. You can get a list of people in the Workspace using [Get Authorized Teams (Workspaces).](ref:getauthorizedteams)

anyOf.title: Emoji (Rating) Custom Field
anyOf.description: Enter an integer that is greater than or equal to zero and where the `count` property is greater than or equal to the `value`. You can find the `count` property for each Emoji (Rating) Custom Field using [Get Accessible Custom Fields.](ref:getaccessiblecustomfields)

anyOf.title: Manual Progress Custom Field
anyOf.description: Enter a number between the `start` and `end` values of each Manual Progress Custom Field. For example, for a field with `start: 10` and `end: 30`, sending `current: 20` will be displayed as 50% complete in ClickUp. You can find the `start` and `end` values for each Manual Progress Custom Field using [Get Accessible Custom Fields.](ref:getaccessiblecustomfields)

anyOf.title: Label Custom Field
anyOf.description: Enter an array of the universal unique identifiers (UUIDs) of the labels you want to apply. You can find the UUIDs available for each Label Custom Field using [Get Accessible Custom Fields.](ref:getaccessiblecustomfields)

anyOf.title: Location Custom Field
anyOf.description: Include the latitude, longitude, and formatted address as defined in the [Google Maps Geocoding API.](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/geocoding/overview)

value.value: This is short or long text in a Custom Field.

delete.description: Remove the data from a Custom Field on a task. This does not delete the option from the Custom Field.

post.description:
Invite a guest to join a Workspace. To invite a member to your Workspace, use the [Invite User to Workspace](ref:inviteusertoworkspace) endpoint. \
 \
You'll also need to grant the guest access to specific items using the following endpoints: [Add Guest to Folder](ref:addguesttofolder), [Add Guest to List](ref:addguesttolist), or [Add Guest to Task](ref:addguesttotask). \
 \
***Note:** This endpoint is only available to Workspaces on our [Enterprise Plan](https://clickup.com/pricing).*

post.description:
Create a new Folder using a Folder template within a Space. This endpoint allows you to create a folder with all its nested assets (lists, tasks, etc.) from a predefined template.
This request can be run asynchronously or synchronously via the `return_immediately` parameter.

parameters.name: space_id
parameters.description: ID of the Space where the Folder will be created

parameters.name: template_id
parameters.description: ID of the Folder template to use.

return_immediately.description: Flag if newly created Object ID should be returned without waiting for the asset itself and all its nested assets to be applied. If set to true, access checks are performed before returning, but the object might not be fully created yet. In case of a timeout on syncronous requests, the of objects from the template will continue to be created past the timeout.

get.description:
View the tasks in a List. Responses are limited to 100 tasks per page. You can only view task information of tasks you can access. \
 \
This endpoint only includes tasks where the specified `list_id` is their home List. Tasks added to the `list_id` with a different home List are not included in the response.

parameters.name: list_id
parameters.description:
To find the list_id:
1. In the Sidebar, hover over the List and click the **ellipsis ...** menu.
2. Select **Copy link.**
3. Use the copied URL to find the list_id. The list_id is the number that follows /li in the URL.

parameters.name: include_markdown_description
parameters.description: To return task descriptions in Markdown format, use `?include_markdown_description=true`.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page to fetch (starts at 0).

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description:
Order by a particular field. By default, tasks are ordered by `created`.\
 \
Options include: `id`, `created`, `updated`, and `due_date`.

parameters.name: reverse
parameters.description: Tasks are displayed in reverse order.

parameters.name: subtasks
parameters.description: Include or exclude subtasks. By default, subtasks are excluded.

parameters.name: statuses
parameters.description:
Filter by statuses. To include closed tasks, use the `include_closed` parameter. \
 \
For example: \
 \
`?statuses[]=to%20do&statuses[]=in%20progress`

parameters.name: include_closed
parameters.description:
Include or excluse closed tasks. By default, they are excluded.\
 \
To include closed tasks, use `include_closed: true`.

parameters.name: assignees
parameters.description:
Filter by Assignees. For example: \
 \
`?assignees[]=1234&assignees[]=5678`

parameters.name: watchers
parameters.description: Filter by watchers.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description:
Filter by tags. For example: \
 \
`?tags[]=tag1&tags[]=this%20tag`

parameters.name: due_date_gt
parameters.description: Filter by due date greater than Unix time in milliseconds.

parameters.name: due_date_lt
parameters.description: Filter by due date less than Unix time in milliseconds.

parameters.name: date_created_gt
parameters.description: Filter by date created greater than Unix time in milliseconds.

parameters.name: date_created_lt
parameters.description: Filter by date created less than Unix time in milliseconds.

parameters.name: date_updated_gt
parameters.description: Filter by date updated greater than Unix time in milliseconds.

parameters.name: date_updated_lt
parameters.description: Filter by date updated less than Unix time in milliseconds.

parameters.name: date_done_gt
parameters.description: Filter by date done greater than Unix time in milliseconds.

parameters.name: date_done_lt
parameters.description: Filter by date done less than Unix time in milliseconds.

parameters.name: custom_fields
parameters.description:
Include tasks with specific values in one or more Custom Fields. Custom Relationships are included.\
 \
For example: `?custom_fields=[{"field_id":"abcdefghi12345678","operator":"=","value":"1234"},{"field_id":"jklmnop123456","operator":"<","value":"5"}]`\
 \
Only set Custom Field values display in the `value` property of the `custom_fields` parameter. If you want to include tasks with specific values in only one Custom Field, use `custom_field` instead.\
 \
Learn more about [filtering using Custom Fields.](doc:filtertasks)

parameters.name: custom_field
parameters.description: Include tasks with specific values in only one Custom Field. This Custom Field can be a Custom Relationship.

parameters.name: custom_items
parameters.description:
Filter by custom task types. For example: \
 \
`?custom_items[]=0&custom_items[]=1300` \
 \
Including `0` returns tasks. Including `1` returns Milestones. Including any other number returns the custom task type as defined in your Workspace.

value.value: This is a string of text added to a Custom Field.
This is a string of text added to a Custom Field.

post.summary: Create List From Template in Folder
post.description:
Create a new list using a list template in a folder
This request runs synchronously by default with `return_immediately=true`. The request returns the future List ID immediatly, but the List might not created at the time of the request returning.
Small temmplates can be applied syncronously, which guarantees that all sub objects are created. In case of a timeout on syncronous requests, the of objects from the template will continue to be created past the timeout.

parameters.name: folder_id
parameters.description: ID of the Folder where the List will be created

parameters.name: template_id
parameters.description: ID of the template to use

404.description: Template, folder, or space not found

post.summary: Create List From Template in Space.
post.description:
Create a new List using a List template within a Space. 
This request can be run asynchronously or synchronously via the `return_immediately` parameter.

parameters.name: space_id
parameters.description: ID of the Space where the List will be created

parameters.name: template_id
parameters.description: ID of the template to use

return_immediately.description: Flag if newly created Object ID should be returned without waiting for the asset itself and all its nested assets to be applied. If set to true, access checks are performed before returning, but the object might not be fully created yet. In case of a timeout on syncronous requests, the of objects from the template will continue to be created past the timeout.

start_date.description: Project start date for remapping dates

due_date.description: Project due date for remapping dates

schema.description: Response object returned when a new List is created from a template in a Folder or Space.

id.description: Unique identifier of the newly created List

list.description: Detailed information about the created List

id.description: Unique identifier of the List (matches parent id)

deleted.description: Indicates if the List has been marked as deleted

orderindex.description: Position of the List relative to other Lists in the same container

priority.description: Priority level of the List, if applicable

assignee.description: Default assignee for the List, if applicable

due_date.description: Default due date for tasks in the List

start_date.description: Default start date for tasks in the List

folder.description: Information about the parent Folder containing this List, if applicable

id.description: Unique identifier of the parent Folder

name.description: Display name of the parent Folder

hidden.description: Indicates if the Folder is hidden from standard views

access.description: Indicates if the current user has access to this Folder

space.description: Information about the Workspace Space containing this List

access.description: Indicates if the current user has access to this Space

inbound_address.description: Email address that can be used to create tasks in this List via email

archived.description: Indicates if the List is archived

override_statuses.description: Indicates if this List uses custom statuses instead of Space default statuses

statuses.description: List of available statuses for tasks in this List

orderindex.description: Position of this status in the status list

color.description: Color code associated with this status

type.description: Category of the status (e.g., open, closed, in progress)

status_group.description: TODO - Identifier for grouping related statuses

permission_level.description: Access level the current user has for this List (e.g., create, edit, view)

400.description: Bad request - Name is required, or is already taken

404.description: Template, folder, or space not found

post.description:
This endpoint creates a [User Group](https://docs.clickup.com/en/articles/4010016-teams-how-to-create-user-groups) within a Workspace.\
 \
User Groups are used to organize and manage users within a Workspace.\
 \
In the API documentation, `team_id` refers to the Workspace ID, and `group_id` refers to the User Group ID.\
 \
**Note:** Adding a guest with view-only permissions to a Team automatically converts them to a paid guest.\
 \
If no paid guest seats are available, an additional member seat will be added, increasing the number of paid guest seats.\
 \
This change incurs a prorated charge based on the billing cycle.

parameters.name: team_id
parameters.description: Workspace ID

put.description:
This endpoint is used to manage [User Groups](https://docs.clickup.com/en/articles/4010016-teams-how-to-create-user-groups), which are groups of users within your Workspace.\
 \
In our API, `team_id` in the path refers to the Workspace ID, and `group_id` refers to the ID of a User Group.\
 \
**Note:** Adding a guest with view-only permissions to a User Group automatically converts them to a paid guest.\
 \
If you don't have any paid guest seats available, a new member seat is automatically added to increase the number of paid guest seats.\
 \
This incurs a prorated charge based on your billing cycle.

type.description: The type of view to create. Options include: `list`, `board`, `calendar`, `table`, `timeline`, `workload`, `activity`, `map`, `conversation`, or `gantt`.

get.description: View information about a specific task or page view.

put.description: Rename a view, update the grouping, sorting, filters, columns, and settings of a view.

parent.title: Parent
parent.description:
The parent parameter specifies where the view is located in the ClickUp Hierarchy. Both `id` and `type` are required. \
 \
The `id` is the id of the Workspace, Space, Folder, or List where the view is located. \
 \
The `type` value indciates the level of the Hierarchy where the view is located.

id.description: The id of the Workspace, Space, Folder, or List where the view is located.

type.description:
The level of the Hierarchy where the view is created. \
 \
Options include: \
 \
Workspace (Everything Level): `7` \
 \
Space: `4` \
 \
Folder: `5` \
 \
List: `6`

field.description:
Set the field to group by.\
 \
Options include: `none`, `status`, `priority`, `assignee`, `tag`, or `dueDate`.

dir.description:
Set a group sort order using `1` or `-1`.\
 \
For example, use `1`show tasks with urgent priority at the top of your view, and tasks with no priority at the bottom.\
 \
Use `-1` to reverse the order to show tasks with no priority at the top of your view.

fields.description:
Include an array of fields to sort by.\
 \
 You can sort by the same fields available when [filtering a view](doc:filter-views).

op.description: The available operator (`op``) values are `AND`` and `OR``.

fields.description: View the list of [fields available](doc:filter-views) to filter by.

columns.title: Columns
columns.description: Custom Fields added to a view at the Everything level will be added to all tasks in your Workspace. Once Custom Fields are added to one of these views, you cannot move it to another level of the Hierarchy.

fields.description: Custom Fields require the `_cf` prefix and must be formatted as a JSON object.

show_subtasks.description: Acceptable values are `1`, `2`, or `3`, which show subtasks separate, expanded, or collapsed.

Set up a webhook to monitor for events.
We do not have a dedicated IP address for webhooks. We use our domain name and dynamic addressing.

To subscribe to specific events, pass an array of `events` that you want to subscribe to, or use the wildcard character `"*"` to subscribe to everything.\

If you don't specify any events, all events will be sent to the webhook.

post.description: Create Workspace-level audit logs. Audit logs can only be created by the Workspace owner on Enterprise Plans.

parameters.description: The ID of the Workspace.

filter.description: A filter containing the criteria to filter logs by.

userId.description: The user ID. This can be a single user or multiple.

userEmail.description: User emails. This can be a single email or multiple.

eventType.description: Types of events to filter by. Options include `USER_LOGIN`, `USER_LOGOUT`, `CHANGE_2FA`, `CHANGE_PASSWORD`, `CHANGE_EMAIL`, `JOIN_WORKSPACE`, `LEAVE_WORKSPACE`, `REMOVE_FROM_WORKSPACE`, `RESET_PASSWORD`, `ROLE_CHANGE`, `SCIM_PROVISION`, `SCIM_DEPROVISION`, `SCIM_UPDATE`, `ADVANCED_SETTINGS_UPDATED`, `CHANGE_ROLE_PERMISSIONS`, `INVITE_TO_WORKSPACE`, `CHANGE_USER_ROLE`, `CHANGE_SSO_POLICY`, `CHANGE_2FA_POLICY`, `CUSTOM_ROLE_CREATED`, `CUSTOM_ROLE_UPDATED`, `CUSTOM_ROLE_DELETED`, `SCIM_GROUP_CREATED`, `SCIM_GROUP_UPDATED`, `SCIM_GROUP_DELETED`, `GROUP_CREATED`, `GROUP_DELETED`, `GROUP_EDITED`, `GROUP_MEMBER_ADDED`, `GROUP_MEMBER_REMOVED`, `SSO_CONFIG_UPDATED`, `TASK_CREATED`, `TASK_ARCHIVED`, `TASK_DELETED`, `TASK_RESTORED`, `TASK_UNARCHIVED`, `TASK_STATUS_CHANGED`, `TASK_PRIORITY_CHANGED`, `TASK_ASSIGNEES_CHANGED`, and `TASK_CUSTOM_FIELD_VALUES_CHANGED`.

eventStatus.description: Status of events you're filtering by. Options include `success`, `failed`, `started`, `completed`, `error`, `system_error`.

startTime.description: The start time to begin paginating your logs.

endTime.description: The end time to begin paginating your logs.

applicability.description: Type of logs to filter by. Options include `auth-and-security` and `user-activity`. Most use cases will use `auth-and-security`.

pagination.description: The pagination request determines where logs should start and how many to return.

pageRows.description: The number of rows to return.

pageTimestamp.description: The timestamp to index on. This should be the timestamp of the last row on the previous page. If you are requesting the first page, this should be the current timestamp.

pageDirection.description: Pagination direction. This should be set to `before` for most use cases. Options include `before` and `after`.

Authorization_Token.name: Authorization
Authorization_Token.description:
API token required for authentication. Two types of tokens are supported:
**Personal API Key** Obtain from ClickUp's settings page under 'Apps' and add it to the header as `Authorization: pk_...`
**OAuth2 Access Token** Generated through the OAuth2 flow and add it to the header as `Authorization: Bearer {access_token}`
